fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26250].
  {panel}

Hello

We are using Jira 4.4.3
We highly rely on searchrequest-xml results to download data from Jira.
Having urlIcon and other type attributes returned in result make it's very inconvenient to pass the amount through network.

E.g.
<priority id="4" iconUrl="https://www.iajira.amers.ime.reuters.com/images/icons/priority_minor.gif">Minor</priority>. The data 'Minor' comparing to the iconUrl link value.
Another example is 
<customfield id="customfield_11261" key="com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-global-rank">
  <customfieldname>Rank</customfieldname> 
  <customfieldvalues /> 
key value also looks meaningless in that case.

Would be great to have lighter xml result.
fields.summary: Optionally remove iconUrl attribute from searchrequest-xml

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26249].
  {panel}

Hi Support

I have recently been assigned to import projects from JIRA 4.3 and JIRA 4.4.

Here is the story:

* JIRA 4.3 is connecting crowd service
* JIRA 4.4 is using internal user management for users' authentication. But we will use same crowd service for this JIRA instance before migrating projects. 
* I need to export all projects from JIRA 4.3, then import these projects into JIRA 4.4

My questions are:

* Do you have any special documentation for migrating projects from JIRA 4.3 into JIRA 4.4? Is it same process in this article? http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Restoring+a+Project+from+Backup

* As the users' account and groups are considered mandatory for importing projects. As both JIRA instances are connecting to CROWD (not configured at same time).So can users'account & groups from JIRA 4.3 still be found by JIRA 4.4 via CROWD?
 
** If no, is it possible to export DB (userbase) from JIRA 4.3 (or from CROWD?), importing into JIRA 4.4 (or into same CROWD?) with remaining same users' password?
** Do you have any other way to make this work?

Thanks. 

Regards

Sjedi
fields.summary: Migrate Projects between JIRA instances
Update attachment without changing url
Update Changing Custom Field Docs to show and example for new custom field database layout
Ability to disable sending e-mail notifications when Clone issue is performed.
Pressing ctrl-J in the view issue comment field submits the form

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26239].
  {panel}

For example:

* atlassian-mail-1.24 -> 1.25: Changes the return type of MailServer.getSession from alt.javax.mail.Session to javax.mail.Session
* atlassian-mail-1.24 -> 1.25: Removes the dependency on mockobjects-j1.3-j2ee1.3.jar. Unfortunately, we are exporting the classes from this JAR to Plugin v2 plugins through the DefaultPackageScannerConfiguration.
* ...

I am not sure if these changes will even cause any plugins to stop working, but there is a chance.

If we decide not be binary compatible then we will need to cleanup DefaultPackageScannerConfiguration to stop a "Unable to find any resources for package 'alt/javax'" that appears during startup. If we decide to be binary compatible then we will need to ship the JAR again.
fields.summary: The mail changes in 4.4.4-SNAPSHOT are not binary compatible with 4.4.3.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26237].
  {panel}

In certain conditions we often want to do data restoration whteher to restore full data, import a project or rename project key. In all of these operations, a simple corruption in the XML file will result in errors requring that we either edit the xml file ourselves to fix it or fix the problem from the source instance and take a fresh backup. 

A simple scenario is when an external entity (say users from crowd) have null usernames. This will result in an error message as shown in the screenshot below.

!screenshot-1.jpg!

It will be nice that either the JIRA component that generates the XML backup only writes what is needed, or the component that reads in the XML is fixed so that it understands whatever the generator writes.
fields.summary: XML Backup restoration should fix common errors and proceed rather than throwing errors.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26236].
  {panel}

The new Issue Link system field filters out duplicate link descriptions but the original Issue Link dialog does not.

For example, if you have a simple undirected relationship called "Relates" that has "relates to" for its outward description and "relates to" for its inward description (because trying to force direction artificially only makes things more confusing), the Issue Link system field will only show one "relates to" but the dialog shows both.

*Issue Link system field*
!screenshot-1.jpg!

*Link Issue dialog*
!screenshot-2.jpg!
fields.summary: Make the Link Issue dialog box filter duplicates like the new Issue Link system field does
Create add-on to import data from Rally to JIRA
Customize the displayable fields for the time tracking report feature in Jira
Improve JIRA's start-up process in order to prevent the "Could not load custom field type plugin with key 'com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:xxxxx' error from occurring
Image Filenames with Existing Issue Key will not be Rendered in Image Macro
"Add Crowd" in GG gives you crappy options
LDAP Syncronization messages are confusing
Project Admin page when no projects should give you a create project link
Atlassian OnDemand references LDAP incorrectly
Allow Jelly CreateIssue tag to support Priority numeric ID instead of Priority string name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26217].
  {panel}

The current error if you forget the fname element is:
[WARNING] [talledLocalContainer] Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$NullArgumentException: s1 should not be null!

This doesn't tell you what s1 is or where it is located. I wish the error were more like this:
'fname' element missing from 'jql-function' in atlassian-plugin.xml
fields.summary: Need better error when leave "fname" element out of a JQL function plugin XML element
Is it possible to update a status automatically when a custom field is populated? (or vice versa)

fields.description:
Since updating to the 4.4.3 release, all scripts using the remote API fail.  The following script results in a "Connection refused - connect(2) (Errno::ECONNREFUSED" error:


#!/usr/bin/env ruby

require 'soap/rpc/driver'

stub = SOAP::RPC::Driver.new("http://jira.dash.net:8080/rpc/soap/jirasoapservice-v2/", "http://soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com")
stub.add_method('sayhelloto', 'username')
puts stub.sayhelloto('RubyLearning')
fields.summary: Upgrading to v4.4.3 is causing all

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26208].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
There is currently no method to prevent sub-task creation on a specific workflow status.

The following Workflow Properties have no effect on users being able to create sub-tasks.
* {{jira.permission.create}}
* {{jira.permission.subtasks.create}}

Administrators are unable prevent users from creating Sub-tasks with this current bug. When viewing an issue in the state where that permission _should_ be locked down, there is still an option for creating a sub-task.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
JIRA 6.3 was used to replicate this issue:

# Open the Workflow Editor ("Administration -> Projects -> <SELECTED-PROJECT> -> Workflow -> Edit)
# Add the following Workflow Properties to one of the steps: 
* {{jira.permission.create}} and set to {{denied}}
* {{jira.permission.subtasks.create}} and set to {{denied}}
# Publish the edited workflow
# Create a new issue for <SELECTED-PROJECT> and transition to the edited Step (Issue Status).
# Attempt to create a new "Sub-task" for the issue. Observe that the user is able to do so.
# Observe that this "Sub-Task" is created and linked to the issue.

h3. Expected Results
The workflow property should have prevented the Sub-Task from being created.

h3. Actual Results
The workflow property had no effect on the User's ability to create a new Sub-Task.

h3. Notes
* Attached Screenshots for all windows showing the settings applied when demonstrating this issue. (JIRA 4.4)
* Specifically: One of the permissions is the Create permission, which was denied to everyone.
* When viewing an issue in the state where that permission should be locked down, there is still the option for creating a sub-task.
* User was able to click on "Create Sub-Task" and create a sub-task which looks fine and shows that it is a sub-task of the parent issue.  However, when you go back to the parent issue, you do not see any sub-tasks for that issue. (JIRA 4.4)
* The last part of the parent not knowing of it's sub-tasks is not very important because the first part of a sub-task still being able to be created shouldn't even be available or allowed based on the permissions that i set in the state of the workflow. (JIRA 4.4)
* [JRA-10077|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-10077] - Mentions a suggestion to refactor some of the permissions relating sub-task creation.

h3. Workaround
In some circumstances users can prevent all edits to an issue at a specific workflow status:
# Edit the project Workflow, as per: [Configuring Workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA063/Configuring+Workflow]
# Click "View Properties" for the targeted step.
# Add a new property {{jira.issue.editable}} with value {{false}} (as per [Workflow properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA063/Workflow+properties])
# Publish the edited workflow.

This will prevent *all* edits being made to an issue when at the defined state. The workaround can be used to prevent the user from creating sub-tasks on closed or resolved issues.
fields.summary: Subtasks can be created even when create permission is removed via Workflow state Properties
New Requirement

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26205].
  {panel}

h3. Description
When user opened exported filter to xls file. The exported xls file will open on blank sheet on Libre Office Calc 3.4.x. There's a possibility that this issue is related to Libre Office instead of JIRA, since it can be opened using Libre office 3.3.x.

h3. Findings
# When the attached file is opened using text editor, you will see all the content inside. 
# Ran xml validator against the attached file. Here's all the error returned.
{noformat}
29:20 The reference to entity "R" must end with the ';' delimiter.
58:3 The element type "META" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "</META>".
66:11 The element type "img" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "</img>".
199:15 The element type "tbody" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "</tbody>".
{noformat}


h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Search or select any filter in JIRA.
# Click *View > Excel* and it will generate xls file.
# Open the file using Libre Office Calc 3.4.x.
# Blank sheet will be displayed even though the file has content inside.

h3. Workaround
Open the generated file in Libre Office Calc 3.3.x.
fields.summary: Export filter to excel won't work with Libre Office 3.4.x.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26204].
  {panel}

We got complains from users because they feel they are missing some important notifications. 

Our current notification schemes don't inform watchers about Issue Assigned, Issue Updated and Issue Edited, but watchers expect to get all comments.

However JIRA doesn't fire Issue Commented, when the comment is added through  an edit issue or through another screen. The only way to fire the event seems to be using Comment buttons.

The expected  behavior is firing the Issue Commented event whenever a new comment is added into jiraaction.
fields.summary: Issue Commented event is not fired when a comment is added through a screen
Ability to customize JIRA's mail through Administrator Console

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26202].
  {panel}

These are the steps to prodocue the error:

# Create a customfield (any field). As an example: User name
# Create a search filter containing that customfield (Ex: Project = "Test" AND User name = "user01"
# Save that filter.
# Rename the customfield. Ex. From User name to Username
# Access the previous filter and the filter will not show any result.

To prevent this, you can change the JQL query from User name to the custom field ID (IE cf[10010]).  However, it is not user-friendly for customers who are preferably using the simple search.  

It would be convenient for all the users if the simple search feature on the Issue Navigator uses the custom-field ID from the beginning rather than the custom-field name. It would definitely make changes to the custom-field's name more adaptable.
fields.summary: Changes in Custom Field Name causes failure of saved Filters
Table sent via mail to add as comment is corrupted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26198].
  {panel}

There seems to be confusion with the wording on this page:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Supported+Platforms

In regards to our supported version of Firefox (and other browsers possibly)

In order to clear this up where it says "Latest stable version supported"
Can it be changed to something like " Latest stable version upon release supported " 
or something to that amount. It's been assumed previously that the latest version of Firefox (etc...?) is supported even though that version of Jira was released before that version of Firefox.
fields.summary: Changes supported platforms Re: Firefox "Latest stable version supported"
Saved filters with names like '&' can't be searched for

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26193].
  {panel}

When converting to a Sub-Task in Jira, it doesn't let you type in the issue number in lowercase. All other places will automatically convert it to uppercase for you, so this one trips me up.

Steps:
1.	More Actions > Convert to subtask
2.	Type in the parent issue in lowercase
3.	Next
Expected: Issue is converted to uppercase and it finds it
Actual: Issue is not converted to uppercase so you have to retype it in uppercase
fields.summary: Convert to subtask - Allow the user to enter the issue in lowercase
Update the JIRA 4.4 Documentation about "Restoring a Project from Backup".
Mail Handlers should be instantiated in the way enabling dependency injection

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26185].
  {panel}

# View either the Version Page, Project page or even the issues page while logged in.  
# Log out in another window, or expire the session.
# Click on the builds tab

You dont have permission to see the builds tab when logged out. On the Version and Project page, the builds tab stays selected but it loads the content of the summary tab.  On the Issue page it goes to a random tab and the builds tab disapears (this one makes sense I guess).

On all three pages and clicking on any of the tabs, JIRAs header continues to tell me I'm logged in.
fields.summary: Weird behaviour when clicking on tabs I dont have permission to see
"You have issues!" banner found to be confusing
Add ability to tag users in comments
Ability to filter the values in a select list based on a group picker selection

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26175].
  {panel}

    Jira uses binary ordering for the project name instead of using better alphabetical order even if the database is set otherwise. For example in Oracle we set our database so that NLS_SORT is French. This causes the database to not make the difference between accentuated letters and non accentuated ones. This means that an "É" is like an "E".

    This means that if you have the following project names : "Assurance", "Cadre de gestion", "Engagement", "Évaluation" and "Suivi des dossiers", the order written before is the good one. But Jira will write "Évaluation" as the last one. Since we have around 30 projects it's annoying that the "Évaluation" project does not appear where it belongs in the alphabetical order.

    This happens in all the place where projects are listed, i.e. the create issues screen, the project list page, in the project gadget, etc.

    Jira should rely on the order set by the database or have a parameter to set the way Jira works.


    I've contacted customer support, who told me to open an improvement request. If you want to see the support ticket it's JSP-95853.

    I also included a screenshot that shows the top and the bottom of the project list. You will see the "Évaluation financière des conditions de travail" project at the end of the list instead of before the "Formulaire d'admissibilité 44/48" project.
fields.summary: Project order should not be binary

fields.description:
I installed the German language plugin for https://bsmediavision.jira.com.
When I try to log out I get an error message, see screen shot attached.
Refreshing the site results in jumping back to the English.
fields.summary: After setting default language to German logging out does not work anymore

fields.description:
When a MS Active Directory User Directory is added to JIRA the user-picker used for editing the project roles always returns "No Matches".
Searching users at other places (e.g. when editing the project lead) works.
Shortly after adding the directory the user-picker is working as expected. 
But after a restart of JIRA it's not working anymore.

Our AD contains about 44000 users in 2 groups.
fields.summary: User Picker stops working after restart (with MS-AD User Directory)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26169].
  {panel}

We are using JIRA in our company for some weeks and now, we would like to add our customers to JIRA. 
For this, we created a custom field named 'customer' (select list) which contains our custumers as items. 
Due to our customers data are maintenanced in another system, we created an import mechanism for our customers to JIRA. 
As first step, we created a JIRA plugin with custom filters, which workes fine. (The plugin just contains the atlassian-plugin.xml with system.preset.filters) 
Our problem is now, that we need to add the items for our custom field 'customer' by the plugin. 
Alternativly, we could create a custom field of the type 'select list' with our customers as items within the plugin.
We searched for this in the 'JIRA Plugin Guide' but couldn't find an plugin module which gives this possibility. 
(We found the 'Custom Field Plugin Module' and found there, how to create a new type of custom field, but not, how to create a custom field using an already existing type.) 
Please, could you give us a reference to how to resolve this?
fields.summary: Creating a custom field within a plugin using the 'select list'-type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26165].
  {panel}

Looking at my profile on EACJ, JIRA tells me that my time zone is:

Time Zone:(GMT+10:00) Sydney

This is quite confusing to me, as Sydney's local time zone is currently GMT+11. I can't tell if this means "GMT+10, which is what Sydney is usually on" or "Sydney time, which is usually GMT+10"

I'd like my times to always display in my current local time; so depending on which interpretation is correct, I either need to manually change this to "GMT+11" while DST is in effect; or leave it alone and let JIRA work its magic.
fields.summary: JIRA is ambiguous when describing timezones
permission to edit workflows to single person

JIRA's timezones are out of date - update joda-time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26156].
  {panel}

When a user directory is deleted, the users are still in the database. Customer wishes to also have the users removed. His argument is as follow:
"
If you create a directory and then remove the directory, what need is there to keep information around as you do?
Yes is a problem to have this data around after you have deleted the directory.
As there is a bug in change a directory setting and one way to resolve that bug is to recreate the directory and remove the old one. And if you choose this strategy then you will end up with a alot of old data in the db that is never used. We have 45.000+ user and 35.000+ groups, make the above operation a couple of time and you will start to have performance issues.

We view this a bug or a mandatory improvement that you need to fix.
"
fields.summary: Remove users at the same time as their parent user diretory is removed

Class: com.atlassian.sal.jira.lifecycle.JiraLifecycleManager
Method: onJiraStart(JiraStartedEvent event) 

Problem: Documentation for this method is incorrect. Right now it seems to be copied over from other method in this class onFrameworkStart().

It will be great if you can update the documentation. Also can you explain if this method onJiraStart() gets called once JIRA is completely started or before it get started.

This will help us to write the Scheduler JOB if this is really the event fired up when JIRA is completely started.

regards,
Raju

Link to documentation: 
http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/5.0-beta3/com/atlassian/sal/jira/lifecycle/JiraLifecycleManager.html#onJiraStart(com.atlassian.jira.extension.JiraStartedEvent)

*Steps to reproduce*

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26134].
  {panel}

If there is a network issue, such as not having a proxy set, the plugin management administration fails silently. The existing plugins will display, but when trying to expand them, the screen eventually times out and does not return any information OR a failure. Likewise, one is unable to Upgrade, Install...

These are some of the pages effected:
.../plugins/servlet/upm#manage
.../plugins/servlet/upm#upgrade
.../plugins/servlet/upm#install

It is easy to test this behavior by entering a bad proxy in $JIRA_INSTALL/bin/setenv.sh:

JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS="-Dhttp.proxyHost=proxy.BOGUS.com -Dhttp.proxyPort=1234"

Note that there is no indication on the screen that there was a failure (to reach the Atlassian server). This is a silent failure.
The only hint I could find in the log files was:

[upm.rest.representations.PluginRepresentation] Failed to retrieve Plugin Version from PAC
fields.summary: Plugin management (upm) fails silently when unable to reach Atlassian server (no proxy, firewall, ...)
Add workstation supported version of JAVA in Supported Platforms page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26128].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 16 March 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for your feedback and comments on this issue. We recently implemented JRA-14369, which resolves several of the improvements described on this issue – specifically, you can now selectively add and remove values during a bulk edit operation for JIRA's system multi-select fields, including labels, components, affects versions, and fix versions.

We have decided to close this ticket because we have no plans to address the remaining requests around label management. Our intent is to ensure that there is a functional difference between Components and Labels. One is a lightweight "tag" that any user can create, one is a set of objects created by a project administrator. We would prefer to extend the capabilities of each of these features individually, rather than allow their functionality to overlap more than it already does.

We expect the new bulk edit functionality to make it substantially easier to correct cases where you need to "merge" labels. There is also a [free add-on on the Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/ca.uwo.jira.plugins.labelbot] to assist with this.

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Wouldn't it be nice to have a way to manage Labels, maybe from the Project Administration screen? Currently there is not a way to mass manage Labels. Doing a Bulk Edit on a set of issues replaces (removes) all current Labels with only the new label for all issues, instead of adding the new label to the existing label set for each issue. This makes Bulk Editing Labels almost useless, since it is very uncommon to have issues with all existing Labels in common. Being able to Bulk Add/Remove/Rename a label, would be incredibly convenient. 

Wouldn't it be nice to be able to merge Labels? Sometime users will create different Labels which essentially mean the same thing, management should be able to merge these Labels. For instance 'grey' + 'gray' >> 'grey'.

Wouldn't it be nice for management to be able to lock-down Labels? Sometimes users are just down right bad at creating appropriate Labels, and once a bad label is created, other users start using it as well. Maybe from Project Administration, administrators could create a set of Labels to be used in that project, and then users could only select from that set of Labels. If a user really feels like they need a new label it could always be requested.
fields.summary: Label Management
As a plugin developer I would like to add web-items to issue navigator menus

fields.description: After 28 October 2011 I have incorrect time (an hour earlier that is) in created issues and in comments. I patched my Java ["Timezone Updater Tool"|http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/tzupdater-readme-136440.html] before and in Jira log everything is correct.
fields.summary: Incorrect time in created issues and in comments after 28 October 2011 in Russia

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26122].
  {panel}

With JIRA 5 Beta 2 REST API, when calling createMeta or editMeta like:

http://jiraserver.my.company.com:8080/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?projectKeys=Project1&issuetypeName=Bug&expand=projects.issuetypes.fields

the returned value does not contain the custom field options. It only returns:
"customfield_10002":
	{"required":false,
	 "schema":		 
                {"type":"array",
                 "items":"string",
                 "custom":"com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:select",
                 "customId":10002
                 },
	"operations":[]
	},

We would like the return to contain the option values so we can show them in the UI as a combo-box for end user to make selection.

Is it possible to add this support to JIRA REST API?

Thanks.
Yong
fields.summary: Get list of custom field options as part of createMeta or editMeta
Need an update button at the top of the Edit Issue screen

fields.description:
Total number of votes is too coarse a metric, it can't distinguish between a slow burn that affects a few users over a long period and a fast burn that affects many users in a short period.  You also can't tell if the urgency surrounding an issue has decreased (a sign that it might no longer be relevant, for example a request to integrate with a product people are no longer using).

Adding the ability to filter votes by the time the vote was cast (via the changed operator, for example) would let you answer really interesting questions like "What issues have people voted for in the last day/week/month"?

This would be most useful if there were also a means of filtering by the number of votes, as in "Show me all the issues that have more than X votes in the last Y days".  With that information, you could set filters to keep you up to the minute on issues that are becoming more popular.
fields.summary: Add the ability to filter votes by the time the vote was cast...

fields.description:
A JQL function to search by the number of comments would be useful in a number of situations:

# You could look for tickets with a low amount of interaction.  
## In support, we might use this to find cases where the customer never got back to us so we can phone them.
## In development, you might use this to search for older issues that are still awaiting a comment from the development team.
# You could look for tickets with a high amount of interaction.  
## In a development context, this might be another measure of issue popularity.   
## In a support context, you would want to add as much value as you can in the first interaction, and could review cases that required more than N bounces to resolve.  
## In any context, this could be used to look for trends or flame wars that need review.

Filtering by who the comments are made by (especially by groups) would be helpful, as would filtering for comments made by assignee or reporter.  As an example, I could search for:
# Issues where there are no comments by anyone other than the reporter, for example, to help find cases that have had no meaningful response.
# Popular issues where there are no comments by the company.

The last example would be improved if you could also filter for the number of comments in a particular date range.  Imagine being able to look for issues with a huge number of comments in the last month that have no comment from the developers.
fields.summary: Add a JQL function to filter issues by the number of comments...
Ability to change the colours of Actions and Operations in the menu buttons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26116].
  {panel}

The following has been reported by a JIRA user:

{quote}
1. Create an XML workflow on a test server using "XML" function from WorkFlow --> View Follows
2. Copy the XML to production server
3. On the JIRA production URL, go to Issue --> Workflows Import, select "import a workflow from XML."
4. Enter Name and File Path, click the "Import" button
5. Error occured,
{quote}

Although it's understood that importing workflows form different systems have limitations on them (IE: if there are plugins in the exported system that are not in the imported system that the workflow relies on, it will error)

Unfortunately when an import fails these errors don't mean anything to our customers, they may simply believe that the importer does not work. 

To solve this there could be possibly of mixture of 2 routes:

# Report to the user in plain terms which plugins are missing and ask them to install them
# On error search for those plugins through the UPM and then prompt the user to download them, and (if restart is not required) reattempt the import.

This could prove for a much smoother user experience.
fields.summary: Smart Import Workflow
Rename Gadget title "Activity Stream" to "JIRA Activity Stream"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26112].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,

requests from self-refreshing gadgets cause a lot of (unnecessary) firewall traffic, when the JIRA instance is based in a DMZ. The requests go through the firewall because the baseURL variable is set to the NAT address of the instance. Of course it's possible to change the baseURL to localhost, but then links in e-mail subscriptions and notifications wouldn't work any longer. 

That's why I think a seperation into an internal and external baseURL would be very helpful. External baseURL could be used in e-mail notifications. Internal baseURL could be used for operations/requests that don't leave the domain like the refresh of a gadget.

I already had opened a support request https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-95077. There I was pointed here.

Do you need any additional information? If there's already a workaround or a another solution I really would appreciate to read about it.

Kind regards,
Falk
fields.summary: BaseURL and URL for self-refreshing gadgets should be split up

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26111].

The [Building JIRA from Source| http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Building+JIRA+from+Source] is not up to date, making impossible to build the JIRA 4.4 following the documentation

It's informing people that *Activation* 1.0.2 and *Mail* 1.3.2. Are necessary for the build. Those are not the versions in use in JIRA 4.4.x.
Currently JIRA is using Activation 1.1.1 and Mail 1.4.1.

Also, the build will fail due to a bug already reported [JRA-25319| https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-25319]. That has a plain simple workaround, that could be informed in the documentation so the customers won't face the problems and would possibly avoid support tickets.
fields.summary: Documentation for Building JIRA 4.4 is not correct

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26106].
  {panel}

Scenario:
- I want to create a bug with labels on a JIRA instance. The create issue screen does not have the Labels field configured (for whatever reason, maybe the admin doesn't know how to do it)
- When I bring up the quick create issue dialog, I can't set the labels. 

Problems with these:
a) This means that now I have an extra step on the workflow, I create the issue and then need to click on a top overlay that has a link to the issue in order for me to be able to add the labels. This may sound like a little thing, but it adds up to dissatisfaction.

b) Less savy users (like me) will be tricked to think that this is a bug in JIRA. If I can set the labels when viewing an issue, surely i can set the labels when creating it. "Hold on, there is no way to do this, I can't get the field, ah! it must be a bug in this new dialog that they added. Let's get rid of it... How do I get rid of it... I *can't* get rid of it? Curse you JIRA !"
fields.summary: Allow user to opt-out of quick create issue dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26102].
  {panel}

When an issue is updated and a fixVersion is added, only the new fixVersion is shown in the email notification.

This is misleading and makes it appear that the fixVersion has been replaced.

Should show all the fixVersions in the notification, and ideally have the added fixVersion color coded as green.

Same for removals - should show removed in red, but at minimum show the current list.

Screen shot of email notification:

https://skitch.com/bryanjrollins/gbxbi/atlassian-mail-jdog-jradev-7173-error-reports-that-pid-is-null-brollins-atlassian.com

!https://img.skitch.com/20111018-jq8xhj1n9e8gpiqcppaid7hrc9.jpg!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26089].
  {panel}

[JIRA Server Hardware Recommendations|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Requirements#JIRARequirements-3ApplicationServer] says:

bq. During evaluation, JIRA will run well on any reasonably fast workstation computer (e.g. 1.5+ Ghz processor). Memory requirements depend on how many projects and issues you will store, but 256MB (of Java heap size) is enough for most evaluation purposes.

However, JIRA 4.4.x is configured to consume minimum ~300MB and max 1GB.

This misleading info can cause some dramas for customers evaluating our applications in virtualised or hosted installs, where resources may be limited.
fields.summary: outdated memory requirement for JIRA installs
Patch develop for email services
Better strategy to avoid multiple unnecessary reindexes on upgrade required
Allow attachments as a column on the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26073].
  {panel}

In 4.4.1 we have users which have duplicate accounts because of their separate account which is in a sub-domain.  I have given the User Directory Sync the base DN, but it should not traverse to the sub-domain unless i explicitly tell it to do so.  All other applications which search LDAP for Microsoft AD do not traverse to any sub-domains unless you tell it to do so.  This is causing even more issues when i tested an upgrade to 4.4.3.

In 4.4.3 the User Directory Sync will not even run successfully because it gets to a group which is also in the sub-domain and throws an error. 

2011-10-26 09:26:31,445 QuartzWorker-0 ERROR ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller] Error occurred while refreshing the cache for directory [ 10000 ].
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: duplicate key: Guests
	at com.google.common.collect.RegularImmutableMap.<init>(RegularImmutableMap.java:62)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap$Builder.fromEntryList(ImmutableMap.java:210)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap$Builder.build(ImmutableMap.java:196)
	at com.google.common.collect.Maps.uniqueIndex(Maps.java:456)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher.synchroniseMemberships(AbstractCacheRefresher.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(AbstractCacheRefresher.java:44)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.UsnChangedCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(UsnChangedCacheRefresher.java:223)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.synchroniseCache(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:619)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectorySynchroniserImpl.synchronise(DirectorySynchroniserImpl.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller.pollChanges(DbCachingDirectoryPoller.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.monitor.poller.DirectoryPollerJob.execute(DirectoryPollerJob.java:34)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:195)
	at com.atlassian.multitenant.quartz.MultiTenantThreadPool$MultiTenantRunnable.run(MultiTenantThreadPool.java:72)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:520)

This is going to cause major issues and hence prevents us from even thinking about upgrading to any newer version than 4.4.1.

I have also looked into using the LDAP filter to filter out the sub-domain or only filter in the OUs that i want to Sync, but that is impossible.  Due to the LDAP standard for Microsoft AD, you cannot use wildcards when filtering by distinguishedName, so it can't be filtered by OU by that method.
fields.summary: User Directory Sync using Microsoft AD pulls in groups and users from sub-domains when not requested.
Issue Type Migration wizard shows incorrect values on confirmation page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26067].
  {panel}

This issues is related to JRA-1423 and JRA-1993 but is distinct.

As a user, I want an Atlassian-supported workflow to set the Estimated Time Remaining to be set to zero when resolving or closing an issue.

The aforementioned bugs indicate a clear need by many people to zero the Estimated Time Remaining on issues upon closing or resolving. The info note on the JIRA close issue form even states "Closing an issue indicates that there is no more work to be done on it, and that it has been verified as complete," which indicates to me that zeroing the remaining time is the expected behavior. This was partially mitigated when using GreenHopper as the close/resolve screens had the default option to zero the remaining time, but this useful feature has been removed from those GreenHopper screens.

Requiring every user to manually add post functions is error-prone and places an undue burden on the end-user. I would prefer this action to be part of the default system workflow; however, it would be acceptable to provide a second system workflow or the option to add the zeroing behavior to the default.
fields.summary: Atlassian-supported workflow should include setting Estimated Time Remaining to zero

fields.description:
Hi,

Can we have the option in JIRA to search on issues without stemming the search words.
So now it is not possible to search for the exact word "copies". When we type any of the following options :

summary ~ \"copies\" 
summary ~ "copies" 
summary ~ copies

JIRA still searches for all words like copy, copying, copy, copies etc.

There are also certain "stop words" that JIRA ignores while searching. SO if we search for  "not working", JIRA internally searches for "working, work, worked" etc.

This is not the desirable and caused un-expected behavior for the customers.

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Option to search in JIRA without stemming words.
customization of quick search
Linking code is extremely slow on the view issue page
Ability to save the user's input when creating an issue ticket
JIRA should have auto-upgrade

As a JIRA admin, I can create a post function for a workflow transition that rolls back the status of the issue to the previous status in order to create an "On Hold" state that, when changed, goes back to the last status
Workflow Designer should allow users the ability to add polygonal line segments for a transition
As a JIRA admin, I can export or copy the email addresses of all of the users in a group in order to send an email or create a meeting invitation for the group external to the JIRA application
When using the "Assign" lightbox, if the "Assignee" is not changed, then...

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26044].
  {panel}

Upgrades are frustrating, why?
1- server.xml changes are not migrated
2- additions to cacerts are not migrated
3- mail and activation jars are always placed back in WEB-INF and not lib
4- crowd.properties is not copied over

Really annoying, can you please enhance your upgrade script to be smarter?
fields.summary: Make the upgrade process easier
